intro: Pourthiaea hookeri, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its compact, bushy growth habit. The plant features velvety, dark green leaves and produces clusters of showy, tubular flowers in various colors. It is widely cultivated as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and ease of care. The botanical name honors the botanist William Hooker, who contributed significantly to plant taxonomy.
